addressleaf.section:
To
e honorable S
r
Robert Sidney knight L. Governor of
e towne of Flushing
To the [.] my very singular good [.]

page.lettertext:
fol.200r
S
r
Tho Bodley to S
r
Robert Sydney
I doe not doubt but yo
r
L. is informed
of her
Ma
ties
desire to have some companies
from hens, for
e service of
Rouen.
There
was never worse time to propose suche a mater,
for
at
e Deputies of
e
states
are all in their
Provinces, and no assemblie held at all. And
as for this councel, it is unpossible to drawe
them to determine upon it, for
at it
passeth
their
commission, to send any forces out of
e territories
of
e c
o
trey. Howbeit w
t
muche a doe, and
w
t
long debate I have brought them to
this
,
at albeit they can give no licence, yet they
will be contented, by way of continunation and
secret permissi
o
, to suffer them to passe, and
to cast it upon us,
at are heere for her Ma
tie
w
ch
I thought expedient to rec tifie w
t
all possi-
ble speede, to
e ende
at suche
mission, as yo
r
L. is to make, may be presently prepared. For
e commissary
Sparhawke
is already dispatched
w
t
patents to those places, where
e companies
are in garrison. All is so slient and quiet
heere w
t
us, that I have nothing els of worth
to be written to yo
r
L.
For which I bidde
yo
w
for this present most hartely farewell.
Fr
o
e Hage. N
o
21 1591
Yo
r
L. most assured and at c
o
maundem
t
Tho. Bodley.
